messages: 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (10:30): 22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592, start meeting
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (10:30): is starting a teleconference
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (10:30): logging to http://www.w3.org/2009/06/04-CSS-irc
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (10:30): 4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240, make logs member
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (10:30): I have made the request, 22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (10:30): 17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf, this will be Style_CSS FP
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (10:30): I do not see a conference matching that name scheduled within the next hour, 22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (10:30): Meeting: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) Working Group Teleconference
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (10:30): 17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf, remind us in 8 hours to go home
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:31): scribenick b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:31): topic: gcpm
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:31): hakon: at last f2f, changes to the draft included: image res property, list of features for WD

104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (10:32): Present: Sylvain Galineau, Steve Zilles, Daniel Glazman, Bert Bos, Anne van Kesteren, Alex Mogilevsky, H?•kon Wium Lie, Molly Holzschlag, Elika Etemad, Arron Eicholtz, Chris Lilley, David Baron
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:32): hakon: i proposed to drop anything that has to do with moving elements
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:33): hakon: floating into footnotes remain
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:33): hakon: moving elements may conflict with generated content
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:34): hakon: what's left now is mostly implemented by two UAs
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:34): hakon: Prince and Antenna House
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:40): (hakon showing updated GCPM spec)
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:40): hakon: dropping moving elements e.g. target-text
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:41): hakon: one issue is what do we do with advanced multicolumn features since no one has implemented it
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:43): discussion of CMYK and whether it makes sense for publishing
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:44): hakon: this is customer requirement to produce PDFs for instance
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:44): chrisl: this should really be called device cmyk
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:45): chrisl: there is a standard to specify color profiles
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:45): ACTION: review GCPM CMYK (section 16) and suggest changes/improvements  ac3b293515e969dace7717d9104ad079)
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (10:45): noticed an ACTION. Trying to create it.
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (10:45): Sorry, couldn't find user - review
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (10:45): records action 1
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:47): hakon: note that character substitution (text-replace) "applies only to batch processors"
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (10:47): http://dev.w3.org/csswg/css3-gcpm/#text-replace
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:47): szilles, others: what is a batch processor ?
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:48): dglazman, chrisl: non-interactive agent
04c6178a6b383efd09549f9028ece8b4 (10:48): http://dev.w3.org/csswg/css3-gcpm/#text-replace
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:49): hakon: note that "This property is evaluated after the content property and before text-transform....it is applied after the white-space property"
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:49): dglazman: this is useful for localization. but is it style ?
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:50): dglazman: why not keep the feature, remove the batch processor qualifier and put it at risk ?
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:51): 72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d: alternatively, we need a profile or a statement that interactive rendering engines are not required to support the feature
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:51): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: I don't think it belongs to CSS. it changes content.
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:52): 72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d: if not then the content property is not a style property either
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:53): chrisl, hakon: this property does not alter the DOM

104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (10:53): "This property is applied after the ‚Äòwhite-space‚Äô property." needs to be defined much more carefully, since 'white-space' applies at multiple stages of the processing model

b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:55): ACTION: 04c6178a6b383efd09549f9028ece8b4 to rewrite scope of character substitution; from batch processors to not requiring support from interactive rendering engines
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (10:55): noticed an ACTION. Trying to create it.
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (10:55): records action 2

22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (10:55): Created ACTION-150 - Rewrite scope of character substitution; from batch processors to not requiring support from interactive rendering engines  [on H?•kon Wium Lie - due 2009-06-11].
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:55): ACTION: chrisl to review GCPM CMYK (section 16) and suggest changes/improvements
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (10:55): records action 3
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (10:55): noticed an ACTION. Trying to create it.
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (10:55): Created ACTION-151 - Review GCPM CMYK (section 16) and suggest changes/improvements [on Chris Lilley - due 2009-06-11].
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (10:58): (discussion follows of text processing issues deemed beyond the grasp of 'normal people'; minute-taker assumes he's one of them)
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (11:00): Present+: John Daggett
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (11:06): discussion about a more complete cascading transformation language that would be more useful to printers and drop the feature from the WD
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (11:07): glazman: this is not a stylistic feature and therefore belongs outside the specification
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (11:15): glazman: we can keep as is and scope it to make it optional for interactive rendering engines; or we drop the section from GCPM
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (11:16): hakon: i'm not comfortable with dropping something that is both pragmatic and useful to printers today
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (11:18): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01: as an inherited property, i'm not sure it'd make sense to use it more than once per document
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (11:19): glazman: which brings us some other issues about the feature e.g. whether it's inherited or not
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (11:19): s/glazman 72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d

b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (11:22): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: the main issue is tha the feature as specified is is incomplete/insufficient and will be hard to complete within the context of CSS
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (11:29): 72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d: third option for the property is to scope it to @media print
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (11:29): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: does this mean browsers have to implement it for print ?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (11:29): [apparently yes]

b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (11:31): vote: 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 #2, chrisl #2, arronei #2, elika #2, molly abstains, hakon not 2, alex #2, e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 abstains, bert #2, dglazman #2, szilles #2, b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 #3
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (11:31): options were
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (11:31): #1 scope feature to exclude rendering engines
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (11:31): #2 drop feature
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (11:32): #3 like #1 + restrict to @media print

b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (11:35): alexmog: my problem with this doesn't have anything to do with what it does or why but the state of the feature wrt the rest of the spec. I can't implement it as is and I'd rather implement a spec completely
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (11:41): RESOLVED: character substitution is dropped out of the GCPM working draft
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (11:56): WG proceeds with quick review of GCPM sections to decide its publication as a WD
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (11:58): Hmm, now that we have leaders and leading I wonder if we could get some other variants of either of the base words so we can confuse ourselves more. :-)
72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d (12:00): mentions the Talmud as a good example for multiple footnotes :-)

b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (12:04): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: two issues about footnotes. 1) steve's comment about multicolumn footnotes and 2) what happens to footnotes in scrolling media
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (12:05): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: specifically, where is the footnote box in the document in that case ?
72af1cb61d47fcc5d18402bf3d1c147d (12:06): (ongoing discussion about css3-gcpm)
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (12:09): renaming border-parts to border-clip
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (12:15): ACTION: 04c6178a6b383efd09549f9028ece8b4 to compare and reconcile GCPM border-clip syntax with border-image's

b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (13:16): RESOLVED: keep page floats in the GCPM WD
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (13:20): szilles: I am concerned about the clarity of the dependencies between our outstanding drafts

b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (13:21): szilles: while i'm happy to publish this as a working draft, I'm concerned on our ability to resolve and fix the issues and conflicts that may arise due to those dependencies
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (13:23): hakon: should we rename this module ?
b0faf0091b8793353bfd62455a3bedf2 (13:23): chrisl: garbace collection placeholder module ?
